data.name: H-2A Work Visas
data.description: For agricultural workers with temporary or seasonal job offers in the United States.
detailedInfo: The H-2A visa allows U.S. employers who anticipate a shortage of domestic workers to bring foreign nationals to the U.S. to fill temporary agricultural jobs.
This program is vital for the agricultural sector.

data.name: H-2B Work Visas
data.description: Intended for non-agricultural workers to fill temporary jobs in the U.S. across various sectors.
detailedInfo: The H-2B visa is for workers in non-agricultural occupations.

data.name: B1/B2 Visa (Tourism and Business)
data.description: Allows entry to the U.S. for tourism, visits, medical treatments, or temporary business activities.
detailedInfo: The B-1 visa is for temporary business visitors, while the B-2 visa is for tourism, visits to family, or medical treatments.

data.name: TN Visa (USMCA Professionals)
data.description: For qualified professionals from Mexico and Canada under the USMCA to work temporarily in the U.S.
detailedInfo: The TN visa, derived from the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), allows qualified Mexican and Canadian citizens to work in the U.S. in pre-established professions.
